result.execSummary:
The defendant Floyd Wayne Lee Sr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Provide DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge during extended supervision on 22CF514; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered. Pay all mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges during extended supervision on 22CF514; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered. Court waived all non-mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges finding the defendant indigent.
Defendant is advised he/she and may not possess any firearms.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Floyd Wayne Lee Sr in court, in custody.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court for Floyd Wayne Lee Sr.  Prosecuting attorney Claire E Zyber in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
AS TO COUNT 1: 
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to defendant's plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived their rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he/she and may not possess any firearms. 

Sentencing proceeds. Statements made by the State, defense counsel and defendant. 
.
Defendant sentenced to serve 6 months at the HOUSE OF CORRECTION, concurrent to 22CF1743 and consecutive to 22CF514.
.
COURT ORDERS:
- provide DNA sample and pay DNA surcharge during extended supervision on 22CF514; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered;
-pay all mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges during extended supervision on 22CF514; failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment being entered;
-Court waived all non-mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges finding the defendant indigent.
.
Appeal rights given. Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed. Copy given to defendant. -- gmb
